text: The 1914 Senboku earthquake (Japanese: 1914年秋田仙北地震) occurred on March 15, 1914 at 04:59 or 05:00 local time (or March 14 at 20:00 UTC) according to various sources in northern Japan.The Geology of Japan by T. Moreno, S.R. Wallis, T. Kojima, W. Gibbons, p. 374 The earthquake had a magnitude of 7.0. The epicenter was in Akita Prefecture, Japan. Ninety-four people died and 324 were injured.http://www.histeq.jp/kaishi_28/HE28_152_152_Mizuta.pdf Senboku District (Japanese: 仙北郡) was seriously affected. The earthquake caused liquefaction.http://www.histeq.jp/kaishi_25/HE25_001_027_Takemura.pdf Explosions simultaneous with the earthquake were reported in Mount Asama.The Herald Democrat, March 16, 1914 == References == ==External links== * == Further reading == * Senboku Category:Earthquakes in Japan
title: 1914 Senboku earthquake
